thread.title: Xiaomi and Lenovo Moto brands launched in Pakistan
thread.title_full: Xiaomi and Lenovo Moto brands launched in Pakistan

title: Xiaomi and Lenovo Moto brands launched in Pakistan
text:
Xiaomi and Lenovo Moto brands launched in Pakistan Xiaomi and Lenovo Moto brands launched in Pakistan By - February 20, 2017 “Xiaomi has launched Mi Max and Redmi Note 4, while Lenovo has released Moto Z smartphones in Pakistan” 
Xiaomi has announced that its rebooting is global expansion plans by entering Pakistan. In addition, Lenovo-owned Motorola has re-entered the country as Lenovo Moto. While Xiaomi will initially be selling the Mi Max , Redmi Note 4 and Redmi 4A in Pakistan, Lenovo Moto has started selling the Moto Z and Moto Z Play with modular Moto Mods in the country. 
Talking about Xiaomi first, the brand has entered Pakistan through a distribution partnership with Rocket Internet’s e-commerce marketplace, Daraz, which has a presence in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka. Apart from the aforementioned smartphones, the brand also plans to sell the Mi Band 2 accessory in the country. 
As for Lenovo Moto, the brand launched the Moto Z and Moto Z Play smartphones in Pakistan on February 17th in Karachi. The company will also be launching the Moto M in the country soon. The Moto Z and Z Play are available on Daraz.pk online shopping portal and come bundled with free JBL Soundboost Mods.
